author: shenron
title: Pioneering Legoland town
review:
This tiny set can be considered one of the pioneers for the design of Legoland town sets. As such, it sets some standards for the coming years such as the driver's place and the two-size wheels, and it introduces some killer-popular pieces (the arms and bucket, the road sign, the minifig's spade and pick). But it also certainly have room for improvement: the cabin doesn't yet have a proper seat, and the road block fence is so basic that it should rather have been avoided.

It is nice for such a tiny set to feature two minifigures. One of them has a fairly rare black-and-blue shirt. The other has a common blue shirt with pockets, but it also feature a very rare men-at-work vest that can be found only in '79 construction sets.

author: hustla187
title: Good Start to Lego Town
review: If you always wanted an early Lego town set, this is a good one. You get two minifigures, some cones, and a bulldozer. This set is perfect for the town under construction or working on a new street, this is perfect to have.
